main event: On October 12, 1957, a sighting of an unidentified flying object (UFO) was reported near Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts. The object was described as a sphere with approximately 12 protrusions and appeared to have antennae, was 5 feet in diameter, and had an opaque, fiber glass-like appearance. It descended rapidly, hovered for about 22 seconds, and then departed rapidly, disappearing within 29 seconds.
interesting points: The object remained in the same position from the time of first sighting until disappearance.
It made a rapid descent and hovered for approximately 22 seconds before departing quickly and disappearing within 29 seconds.
It was observed climbing at a 35-degree angle, 12 degrees south of the sun.
The sighting was made from a boat approximately 2 miles northeast of Vineyard Haven, Massachusetts.
The observers included individuals from a research vessel, former USAF major scientist, and a pilot from Charleston, S.C.
witnesses: research vessel crew, former USAF major scientist, pilot from Charleston, S.C.
